column4: Open question on forum: Is anyone else here having trouble with users crontabs? ie do crontab -e then add a cron line * * * * * /bin/date >/tmp/date  . Please let me know if you DON'T get a file called date in /tmp containing the date.
is it configured to allow user crontabs? or maybe you're running anacron
ooks like I am using vixie according to the manual.
I have tried creating cron.allow and cron.deny. Then adding my username to cron.allow.
I think there is a directive that decides if user crontabs are allowed or ignored
Do you know how it is set on feisty by default, and where it is set?
not really. I just think I remember seeing it somewhere
so I guess you already checked syslog?
Yes. cron writes to syslog. Unfortunately, the debugging output is limited.
but you would have noticed any errors at least
make sure you leave a blank line at the end of the file IIRC
have you done that?
I am just checking if that is the problem. Could be.
It looks like the new line at the end of the file is the issue
I use Jed as my default editor. Jed doesn't automatically add a new line before EOF. nano, the Ubuntu defautl editor always leaves \n before <eof>
right. it's been like that for years, thouh.
should definately be fixed, though.
very hard to spot otherwise unless you know
sure
it's a bug that should have been fixed years ago
crontab -e should complain or add the blank line
I've made it a habit to leave a blank line at the end of most config files ;)
